reason: Bitcoin is experiencing back-to-back ETF inflows for the first time in a month, strongly suggesting a renewed accumulation phase by institutional and retail investors. However, this is tempered by a derivatives expert's view that a true capitulation has not yet occurred, implying potential for continued volatility or a retest of lower levels before a sustained markup. Regulatory action against scams adds a layer of caution, while new institutional exchange infrastructure (LMAX) signals long-term positive sentiment. The market is showing conflicting signals of demand amidst lingering uncertainty and potential downside risk.
headlines: Fugitive foreigner sentenced in the U.S. to 20 years for $73 million crypto scam
I'm not confident we hit a true capitulation in bitcoin, derivatives expert says
LMAX unveils new exchange to break the wall down between crypto and FX
AI is no savior when markets get tough … but it can help, says Nickel Digital chief
U.S. bitcoin ETFs register back-to-back inflows for first time in a month
